intro: Triplisomeris ernae, commonly known as the narrow-leaf triplisomeris, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in whorls, typically displaying shades of white and purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
